page.title: 16Bredwardine; Farming I
page.content: Farming is the most important occupation in the area; one-third to one-half of the total population is engaged in this. Farms vary in size from 500 acres down to 25 acres and there are three which form part of a very large estate (Moccas Estate), the western part of which is in our area. Most farms are run by the farmer and his family, although the larger ones employ extra manpower on a regular basis together with some seasonal help. They are all mixed farms, those on high ground being given over largely to grassland and trees, although some cereals and rootcrops are grown. Lower down in the valley wheat, barley, roots, hay for silage and some green vegetables are grown. There is also a fruit farm catering for the 'Pick-Your-Own' trade.
